Description: The forepart of a hollow terracotta saddled horse, broken from a figure modelled in the round. Two rows of circular trappings are round the neck. Two-piece mould. Red-brown Nile silt with little or no mica; dark-grey core. Substantial traces of a white dressing.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Acquired in the Fayum. Roman, third or fourth century AD. Comparanda: Near: Allen 1985: no. 38, from Karanis, dated late third to fourth century AD; Schwartz 1969: pl. xxiiia, from Dionysias in the Fayum. Similar treatment of mane: Török 1995: no. 272. Bibliog: Fischer 1994: no. 1108.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3750)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
